snippet.title: Vertigo: A common problem that left one man teetering for months and months
snippet.description: Spinning for months, a writer searches for a cause — and a cure.

snippet.title: Court chaos: Iraqi man convicted in wife's murder
snippet.description: What began as a hate crime investigation two years ago has led to the murder conviction of an Iraqi immigrant, whose wife was found badly beaten with a threatening note labeling her a terrorist.

snippet.title: Jury convicts husband in Iraqi woman's death
snippet.description: An Iraqi immigrant was convicted Thursday of bludgeoning his wife to death in a case that initially was considered a hate crime because a note found next to her body said: "This is my country, go back to yours, you terrorist."

snippet.title: Gabriel García Márquez, Nobel Prize-winning explorer of myth and reality, dies at 87
snippet.description: Nobel laureate's explorations of myth and reality placed him among the greatest writers of the 20th century.

snippet.title: Cancer-free or not, actress Valerie Harper has already beaten long odds
snippet.description: Actress's cancer usually proves fatal in three to six months.

snippet.title: Anne Arundel County and Howard County crime report
snippet.description: These were among incidents reported by police in Anne Arundel and Howard counties and Annapolis.

snippet.title: Former Marine convicted of first-degree murder in death penalty case
snippet.description: Jurors to return later in the month to determine whether Jorge Torrez should be executed.

snippet.title: Electrical device helps paralyzed men move legs
Death penalty murder case against former Marine goes to jury
snippet.description: Jorge Torrez is charged with first-degree murder in death of fellow soldier at base in Arlington.

snippet.title: A dream design so disabled boys can grow up at home
snippet.description: A dream design for the disabled: Oakton parents build a high-tech home their boys can become adults in
